intro: Dalechampia goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis genus plant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiky structures known as cyathia, which are typical of the family. The plant features palmate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories.
